DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Evaluate feasibility use CT-based imaging blood biomarkers assessment asymptomatic coronary artery disease ( CAD ) survivor allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant ( HCT ) . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Determine prevalence severity asymptomatic CAD , measure CT angiography . II . Describe association patient demographic ( age , sex , race/ethnicity ) , pre-HCT chest radiation , HCT-related exposure ( total body irradiation [ TBI ] , condition chemotherapy ) , graft-versus-host disease ( GvHD ) management cardiovascular risk factor ( CVRFs ) extent CAD . III . Describe association asymptomatic CAD candidate blood biomarkers vessel injury inflammation ( high-sensitivity C-reactive protein [ hs-CRP ] , lipoprotein-associated phospholipase A2 [ Lp-PLA2 ] ) . OUTLINE : Patients undergo cardiac CT collection blood sample analysis hs-CRP via quantitative immunoturbidimetry Lp-PLA2 via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay ( ELISA ) .
